column1: This #Thanksgiving may look different because of #COVID19 but there is so much to be grateful for.    What are you thankful for this year 🦃?

#COVID is spiking in Southern California and across the country.   Please take this seriously. Do everything you can to keep yourself and your families healthy.   ✅ Stay home if you can.  ✅ Wear a mask.  ✅ Avoid indoor gatherings.  ✅ Keep your distance. ✅ Wash your hands.
California residents who think a negative coronavirus test gives them the green light to travel this holiday season should think again officials say. (via @latimes) https://t.co/lQTp9VpG1W
It's another beautiful day in Southern California. It's also a beautiful day to #WearAMask and help do you part to slow the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/y3Ko58Czpy
Hey #CA38 this is important info for Los Angeles & Orange County from @GavinNewsom. We've got to take #COVID19 seriously. https://t.co/oCHDAz6u08

Essential workers are the backbone of our communities. They've kept us going throughout #COVID19. They must be protected and fairly compensated.   I'll keep working with @RepCartwright & my colleagues for our bill (H.R. 6709) to provide hazard pay for essential workers. https://t.co/0Mkxnfi0ux

Thanksgiving is right around the corner and the holiday season follows shortly after that. But #COVID19 is surging and the virus is dangerous ever.  Here's @CDCgov guidance on how to stay safe this holiday season: https://t.co/nTybDf8N7S

This is what American leadership looks like.   Congratulations to President-Elect @JoeBiden and Vice President-Elect @KamalaHarris.  We must work to heal our nation from #COVID19 and the many threats we face.  We've got to do it #ForThePeople.  We've got to do it together. https://t.co/ELSudZENqK

The #COVID19 pandemic is FUELING the housing crisis.   Millions of Americans are facing EVICTION.   #KnowYour Rights. Find out if you qualify for protection from eviction.   Visit https://t.co/2y1QxhcX0E for more information. https://t.co/J4x9vWxiPN

The #COVID19 pandemic is FUELING the housing crisis.   No one should face eviction during a PANDEMIC.   If you’re having trouble paying rent you may qualify for eviction protection.   Visit https://t.co/2y1QxhcX0E for more information.   #KnowYourRights https://t.co/QfHwfGsJBH

Together with @RepRoybalAllard and @rosadelauro and 56 other colleagues I just wrote a letter to @DHSgov.   We want to know if @DHSgov & @CBP will provide migrants in their custody with flu shots and what their plan is to handle flu season amid the #COVID19 pandemic.
Just your daily reminder to please #WearAMask to #StopTheSpread of #COVID19.   We're all in this together.   Check out this info from the @CDCgov 😷 ➡ https://t.co/gUthMzFxb8

School looks different this year as we respond to #COVID19 and work to keep everyone safe.   It was great to speak with #CA38 school superintendents today. I appreciate you our wonderful teachers and dedicated support staff who are keeping students educated and engaged. https://t.co/avCR0i2to3

Families in Southern California and across the country are suffering.   Just when we thought the President couldn't care less about helping Americans recover from #COVID19 he walks away from the negotiating table.   This is disgraceful. https://t.co/nc7jB1FsIl
#COVID19 is still here and still serious. Please continue to take this virus seriously. Wear a mask wash your hands and maintain social distancing. https://t.co/eA1COzlwOh

Check out my latest newsletter with the latest from Washington D.C.:   ✍ #COVID19 updates ✍ the Updated Heroes Act ✍ Getting a flu shot ✍ Natural disaster preparedness ✍ a reminder about the #2020Census   and more! 🇺🇸
Wearing a mask is one of the best ways to stop the spread of #COVID19 to others.   Here’s info on how to wear a mask from @CDCgov ➡ https://t.co/gUthMzFxb8

As you may have heard President Trump has tested positive for the coronavirus. He’ll have access to the best medical care in the world and I wish him and the First Lady a healthy recovery.   For the rest of us it’s a serious reminder to continue to wear a mask.
Tonight I voted to pass the updated #HeroesAct that will help our communities recover from the devastation of the #COVID19 pandemic including the far-reaching economic impacts.

This is another tough blow to the Southern California community and our #workingfamilies and  businesses.   It's up to all of us to step up and #StoptheSpread of #COVID19.   If anyone in #CA38 needs help with federal services please contact my office.  https://t.co/uti11v0V7N
🕘Reminder 🕘  Join me and my @HispanicCaucus colleagues *tomorrow* at 10:30 am ET while we discuss the impact of #Covid19 on Latino communities.  🔗 Link below 🔗 https://t.co/VZDrFWp57r

Today the @WaysMeansCmte held a hearing about restaurants and the #COVID19 pandemic.   I spoke about the devastating impact on the restaurant sector in communities across the country.   A🧵 on 🍽👩‍🍳👨‍👨‍👧‍👧 in 🦠 …

I'm testifying at a @WaysMeansCmte hearing on #SocialSecurity.   The COVID-19 pandemic has hurt every community in our country. But it has hit some far harder than others. The essential labor force is disproportionately made up of Latinx workers. /thread

Working Americans in #CA38 and everywhere: we hear you. We know you are struggling from the #COVID19 crisis.   We are fighting for you and we won't stop until @SenateGOP takes action. https://t.co/W4eluhdgEA
The United States has just surpassed 200000 deaths from #COVID19.   The gravity of this loss is inconceivable.   Two hundred thousand mothers fathers sons daughters friends Americans.
Promoting citizenship gives our immigrant communities a stronger voice in our nation's future. And allows for critical protections during this #COVID19 pandemic. #CitizenshipDay
Get the latest #COVID19 data and information from @lapublichealth so you can keep yourself and your family safe ➡️ https://t.co/UvADwDI4z1
This is good news but the work is far from over. Stay home if you can 🏠 wear a mask if you leave your home 😷 and keep good hygiene 💦.   #COVID19  Via @latimes ➡ https://t.co/PBmJepxJ1v

@WaysMeansCmte I'm proud to have championed several #COVID-19 related tax bills included in the #HEROESAct the House passed in May.   The Senate sat around and did nothing until last week.   As if hunger homelessness and jobless just take pause.   (They don't!)
In fact the same sense of national unity we saw in the days and weeks after the 9/11 attacks has reemerged during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Although this year looks much different – a raging #COVID19 pandemic devastating wildfires across California and the ongoing fight for racial justice – as Americans we can still come together to support and serve one another.

I enjoyed meeting virtually with @EdwardsLifesci today.   We had a productive discussion on how #COVID19 has impacted our communities. It is clear that we must continue our work of addressing access to care and finding solutions to health inequities. https://t.co/F5ajCosnuF
President #TrumpKnew the dangers of #COVID19.   He lied and denied.   How many Americans are dead because of these lies?   #TrumpKnew

I know we are all concerned about the threat of #COVID19 and the fires blazing across the state.   Please remember to take care of yourself.   If you need help @LACDMH's 24/7 Help Line is available. Call (800) 854-7771 or Text “LA” to 741741.

This #LaborDay we remember all who have fought for workers’ rights from the shop floor in the streets and on the picket line.   House Democrats will always live by our commitment to fight for American workers--especially during this #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/AGQxqt38M3

Over the past several months #COVID19 has plunged our nation into a worker safety crisis and the Trump administration has failed to act. This #LaborDay is a reminder that we must stand up for workers’ right to safe workplaces.

This #LaborDay we remember all who have fought for workers’ rights from the shop floor in the streets and on the picket line. House Democrats will always live by our commitment to fight for American workers--especially during this #COVID19 pandemic.

Firefighters Nurses Paramedics Teachers Sanitation workers They are all critical to the fight against #COVID19.  Republicans need to face the facts acknowledge the gravity of this crisis and pass the #HeroesAct to deliver the resources frontline workers need to save lives.
Parents have to work.   And this doesn’t work for #workingfamilies.   Via @CNBC ➡Child-care centers see costs jump 47% due to the coronavirus pandemic

The #COVID19 crisis is hitting state & local government hard – forcing many to make devastating cuts to public education. The #HeroesAct provides nearly $1 trillion in state & local relief to preserve funding for students and schools. #FamiliesFirst

President Trump's disastrous #COVID19 response has made it impossible for many schools to reopen safely.   Now @SenateGOP is refusing to provide schools the funding they need to make classrooms safe. #FamiliesFirst
Simply put this is devastating. #COVID19 is killing our friends family members and our fellow Californians. Where is the national leadership?  Via @latimes ➡️ https://t.co/gvx95CX0z5

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic.   Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/Yguy1z6fOd

Had a great conversation with @LAMedicalAssn today. Thank you for sharing the needs you are hearing from patients in #CA38. We must continue to help families stay healthy and safe as Americans get through the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/0fF5iSbJWT

Essential workers have kept this country up and running during the #COVID19 crisis. Our relief efforts should include them. I fought to include free testing & tracing for EVERYONE in the #HEROESAct because #ImmigrantsAreEssential.  🎨 by @flora_reesa https://t.co/fW2uZxYoce
Join me live tomorrow to discuss resources for small businesses—the hardest hit by the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/oozSrxrUo6

In Congress we need to pass legislation that would allow renters to access short-term assistance. I'm proud to support @RepDennyHeck's Emergency Rental Assistance and Rental Market Stabilization Act to help people withstand the #COVID19 crisis.

Great catching up with @MontebelloCity Mayor Melendez & City Manager Bobadilla today. We are working together to ensure residents and small businesses get the support they need during #COVID19. https://t.co/4i2ItZ5ZhZ

Q: Why do Latinas have a ⬆️ risk of contracting #COVID19?  A: For starters we are more likely to be considered essential workers.  I fought to provide essential workers with hazard pay & cover expenses like child care in the #HEROESAct. @senatemajldr allow a vote on this bill! https://t.co/GxnHoK5Hmd
Did you know that it’s National Health Center Week? In #CA38 we #ValueCHCs and all their work to take care of our communities during #COVID19. #NHCW20 https://t.co/cGJP3vpgsW

One of the things I miss most pre-COVID is grabbing coffee with constituents. I'm resuming these coffee events via Zoom around #CA38 starting with Santa Fe Springs. RSVP today and reserve your spot.  🗓: August 15th   ⏰: 9:30 AM 📬:https://t.co/ET8pBMYhiS https://t.co/zYAjf3EdgN

The number of COVID-19 cases in meatpacking plants is beyond concerning. These workers many of whom are Latino are helping to feed our country and the federal government has the power to protect them. Inaction is unacceptable. https://t.co/ROMUuTQMer

This doesn't look like the V-shaped recovery the White House parroted for months. The #coronavirus is still here which means many Americans aren't going back to work anytime soon. The Senate needs to pass the #HEROESAct & restore emergency assistance for those on the brink. https://t.co/0zaWoAyhZl

(THREAD) Darrell Leroy Nancy Yvette Mary and so many in #CA38 are struggling. They were relying on the $600/week unemployment benefits to get by. @senatemajldr & @SenateGOP let those benefits expire. We have to #SaveThe600 in the next #coronavirus relief package!

Americans rely on @USPS—to get medications pay bills and send letters to loved ones. Our next #COVID relief package MUST #SaveUSPS and protect the right to vote by mail. This issue should not be partisan.
When Republicans give a massive tax cut to the richest Americans but then scrap $600/wk unemployment benefits in their #coronavirus relief proposal. https://t.co/WXPjXEZuqd

$600/week has been a life-saver for so many Americans during the #coronavirus crisis. Tune into the @WaysMeansCmte this morning as we hear their stories & discuss why we must pass the #HEROESActNOW. https://t.co/bImu0B6o5m
More than 150000 Americans have died from #COVID19 and President Trump still doesn't have a national testing and tracing strategy. Shameful

Remember when the @SenateGOP spent more time at their weekly lunch talking about alligator soup than #coronavirus relief?   @HouseDemocrats voted to extend U/I benefits back in May. @SenateMajLdr left for the weekend as millions out of work will lose $600/week.

Child care affordability was a critical problem before the coronavirus crisis. Since March it has only gotten worse. Safe affordable child care is fundamental to our economy reopening. I helped introduce the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act for this very reason. https://t.co/4bRH1aaATk

The #coronavirus pandemic has not gone away and neither has widespread unemployment. Emergency U/I is helping families keep a roof over their heads the lights turned on & food on the table. Taking that away would be a disaster for working families. #ExtendUI #SaveThe600 https://t.co/xyU0gQ5acg

Imaginese si el Presidente Trump pusiera este tipo de esfuerzo en resolver la crisis del #coronavirus.   La constitución es clara: el censo cuenta personas no cuidadanos. Este es otro intento imprudente para disuadir a los inmigrantes de participar en el #Censo2020.

Imagine if President Trump put this kind of effort into solving the #coronavirus crisis.  The Constitution is clear: the census counts persons not citizens. This is another feckless attempt to discourage immigrants from participating in the #2020Census. https://t.co/oYNGQYG4eu
Today at 12 pm ET / 9 am PT the @WaysMeansCmte Subcommittee on Social Security will examine how we can protect beneficiaries during the #COVID19 pandemic.  Tune In 📺 https://t.co/PbOUQbBHYf

If we want our #coronavirus recovery to succeed families need access to high-quality child care. Today I'm testifying before @RulesDemocrats on the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act bold legislation to make safe affordable child care a reality for Americans. Tune In ⬇️ https://t.co/whSaFd0h0S

@Juliana73544124 Hey Juliana my staff are here to help if you have a passport issue. They are working remotely right now due to #COVID19. If you complete the form below someone will be in touch. https://t.co/Kk2enMMlun

I am deeply concerned by the OC Board of Education's decision to reopen schools this fall. Allowing teachers and students back into school without plans to reduce class sizes social distance or wear masks is dangerous.
Please join us tomorrow at 4 pm PT for a discussion on housing rights during the #coronavirus pandemic.  https://t.co/j2JKGdCHIN https://t.co/JT0p5ex2Uc

As of July 13 there were 1382 confirmed #COVID19 cases among children (0-17-years) in OC. Reopening schools with no masks and no social distancing seems like a recipe for disaster. Parents have questions and I want answers. https://t.co/SnrzcY87jh

It's completely unacceptable that in July we are still facing PPE shortages. This is especially true in nursing homes where < 40% of U.S. coronavirus deaths are linked.  The President needs to invoke the #DefenseProductionActNOW. https://t.co/85hTC1hZ6v

#PSA: Ensuring an effective efficient and equitable federal response to the #coronavirus crisis starts with you.  To report waste fraud or abuse of #COVID19 funds: 💻 Visit @COVIDOversight online at https://t.co/AVIL3miA8h 📞 Call 202-225-4400
President Trump is more concerned with getting his cronies out of jail than he is addressing the coronavirus crisis. The American people deserve better.

Can you imagine being separated from your children AND detained in a facility where #COVID19 is rampant? The Trump administration is deciding whether to separate families once again or release families together.  Our message to @ICEgov is clear—#FreeTheFamilies. https://t.co/A0RLirrojJ

Join me next week as I go live with Chancela Al-Mansour from @hrc_la & Stella Verdeja from the Fair Housing Foundation. We will discuss new #COVID19 tenant protections fair housing laws #evictions & common #landlord-#tenant questions. https://t.co/Bx2yXeXqdi

Millions of Americans are still out of work from the #coronavirus crisis. Cases are rising and this pandemic isn't even close to being over. @realDonaldTrump and @SenateGOP need to extend unemployment benefits immediately. https://t.co/ToQB7mtUzC
Not even leaders are exempt from #COVID. Our president needs to meet the seriousness of this pandemic wear a mask and set an example. https://t.co/ckFhTGXbXK

As America confronts the coronavirus pandemic it has never been more important for our community to have access to #LowerCostsForCare. Proud to join other House Democrats think week in taking action #ForThePeople! https://t.co/tzysh0CuuK

Workers across the country are organizing for strong workplace protections during the #COVID19 pandemic.  I'm proud to join @RepAndyLevin & @RepBrianFitz on the SAFE Workers Act to ensure workers can safely and securely vote to form a union without facing health risks. https://t.co/yUwbJvp9pF

Yesterday Congress passed an extension to the Paycheck Protection Program. As the #coronavirus crisis forces many small businesses in #CA38 to stay closed this program is more important than ever.   https://t.co/YaGgN7uBqq

Wearing a mask shouldn't be political. Despite mixed messaging from the White House remember to be vigilant. We all have a responsibility to stop the spread of #COVID19.  Great joining @JohnBerman on @CNN's @NewDay this morning to discuss the rise of cases in California. https://t.co/dcoUcdhre2
HAPPENING SOON: I'm going on @CNN's @NewDay to discuss rising #COVID19 cases in California. Tune in!
You can't drink a beer and wear a mask at the same time. #COVID19 cases are surging again in LA County & around California. This is the right move by @CAgovernor. https://t.co/ojHaGWDd3R
Today is June 28th and we still do not have a national testing strategy. Instead we have a president who thinks more testing means more cases of #COVID19. 🤦🏽‍♀️

Around the country #COVID19 cases are rising and tens of millions are out of work. Yet the Trump admin. is STILL trying to overturn the #ACA & rip away health insurance from 23 million Americans—including 4 million Californians. Absolutely heartless. https://t.co/vvMe2QvD9M

We know that the #COVID19 continues to be deadlier for Black and Latino Americans. This is especially true in nursing homes. Today @WaysMeansCmte Health Subcommittee digs into the COVID-19 crisis in our nation's nursing homes.  Tune in at 11 am PST. https://t.co/8N1Iz1LkeC

Another example of President Trump using his failed response to the #coronavirus pandemic as an excuse to implement his racist anti-immigrant agenda.  This doesn't protect American jobs. It shuts out talented individuals from contributing to our economy. https://t.co/OE9m0qi6rm
Many families continue to rely on food banks like @IFCfightHunger during the #coronavirus pandemic. I'm here today to distribute food to members of the #CA38 community. https://t.co/ypqkhNLF64

On #WRD2020 let's not forget all the immigrant healthcare professionals working to end the #coronavirus pandemic. Immigrants make our country great and asylum seekers have a right to seek refuge in our country.  #ImmigrantHeritageMonth #RefugeesSaveLives https://t.co/BturXUkeWI
Have you seen that #COVID19 cases are rising again in California? During these uncertain times it's never been more important to #getcovered. Head to @CoveredCA and enroll in a plan before June 30.

I have said it before but it needs repeating. While we all might be experiencing the same storm we are not all in the same boat. The #coronavirus pandemic is blowing open the lid on racial #healthdisparities. We need to address them. https://t.co/yBvdLjhJK4

The #coronavirus pandemic has been nothing short of devastating for working families. Today the @WaysMeansCmte Subcommittee on Select Revenue Measures examines ways we can help get families relief and put workers back on their feet.  Tune in: https://t.co/yzE7VUKljn

@HispanicAccess Connecting with nature & exercising is so important for our physical & mental health. As public spaces reopen I try to get outside when I'm not working or distancing learning with my son. We like to ride bikes & explore. We are always careful to keep masks on & social distance.

Si el alivio para #COVID19 nos ha enseñado algo es que los fondos federales importan para la comunidad. Mucho de esto esta determinado por el censo. Participe en el #Censo2020 y #HagaseContar. Fondos para la asistencia médica vivienda educacíon y transporte depende de ello.

If #COVID19 relief has taught us anything it's that federal funding matters for our communities. So much of that is determined by the Census. Participate in the #2020Census & make sure #WeCount. Funding for health care housing education and transportation depends on it.

Earlier this year Congress passed the CARES Act to provide much-needed relief during the #CoronavirusPandemic. If you have not received your relief payment you may need to take additional action. Head to the link below and do so before October 15 2020. https://t.co/xeNBGcr0v3

We are seeing #COVID19 cases rise in LA County as well as several other counties and states throughout the country. The threat from the #coronavirus pandemic is still very real. Anyone who wants to get tested should be able to do so at NO cost. https://t.co/gapOs4XETO

Los inmigrantes son vital para nuestras comunidades sin embargo han quedado fuera de asistencia federal en respuesta al #coronavirus. Acompañenos a mi y a Rigo Reyes de @LAC4Immigrants este miércoles para aprender de recursos disponibles para familias inmigrantes. https://t.co/UelnKqR4ZE

Immigrants are vital to our communities yet too many are getting left out of the federal relief efforts in response to the #coronavirus pandemic. Join me and Rigo Reyes from @LAC4Immigrants this Wednesday as we go live to discuss resources available to immigrant families. https://t.co/YMiFirspil
Black and brown Americans are more likely to be considered essential workers during the #coronavirus pandemic. Those on the frontlines were (& are) more likely to get sick. They deserve hazard pay.

While we all might be experiencing the same storm we are not all in the same boat. It's going to be a long road to recovery from the #COVID19 pandemic. As we work on future relief legislation we can't forget that black & brown Americans are hardest hit. https://t.co/N6SazPPcPd

Como muchos inmigrantes mis padres hicieron sacrificios para que sus hijos tuvieran oportunidades que ellos nunca tuvieron. Este #MesDeLaHerenciaDelInmigrante celebremos a los inmigrantes especialmente aquellos en la primera línea de defensa contra #COVID19. Te agradecemos.

Like many immigrants my parents made sacrifices so their children could take advantage of the opportunities they never had. This #ImmigrantHeritageMonth let's #CelebrateImmigrants especially those on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic. Your country is thankful.

Today is June 1 – 80 days since March 13 the last day of normalcy pre-COVID-19 for many of us. In less than 3 months we have lost over 100000 friends family members and neighbors. Join me at noon to remember them in a moment of silence on this #DayOfMorning & #Lament100k. https://t.co/rCaiEY3dMv

I'm in Washington DC today for @WaysMeansCmte's first virtual hearing due to #COVID19. This pandemic has been brutal especially for communities of color. As we dig out we need to address the health disparities that made this virus deadlier for black and brown people. https://t.co/sl5MD6B80v

Following several months of #COVID19 crisis over a third of Californians are showing signs of anxiety and depression. Join me tomorrow as I go live with Manuel Rosas from @LACDMH to discuss the resources that are available to you. #MentalHealthMonth  https://t.co/j2JKGdCHIN https://t.co/6szDWXB8PP
Today in @WaysMeansCmte we are holding a hearing to highlight the disproportionate impact #COVID19 is having on communities of color.  Tune in: https://t.co/Xyh88wOdx6

A recent poll by @LatinoDecisions found that 1 in 4 Latino Americans know someone who has been infected with #COVID19.   ONE REASON: Latinos & other minority essential workers are on the frontlines of the #coronavirus crisis – without hazard pay sick leave or health insurance.

Great call today with several key nutrition agencies in #CA38. Thank you for stepping up and ensuring that families have access to food during the #coronavirus crisis.  Your work is critical and I continue to fight for additional support at the federal level. https://t.co/eNtMjPe5af

Early decisive action matters during a public health crisis. While President Trump repeatedly downplayed the severity of #coronavirus the disease continued to spread throughout our country. Failing to lead cost many Americans their lives. https://t.co/8MiJMVBx0e

Your skin color should not be a death sentence during a pandemic. Nursing homes with black or Latino residents are being hardest hit by #COVID19. We need to keep shining a light on these inequities and take action to address health disparities. https://t.co/A14H9ps2yp

I'm proud that the #HeroesAct included several of my bills to address these inequalities including: ✅Providing hazard pay to frontline workers ✅Covering expenses like childcare ✅Making #COVID19 testing treatment & immunization free for ALL—regardless of immigration status

Great piece by @jorgeramosnews highlighting the added challenges facing many Latinos during the #coronavirus crisis. Many Latinos work in sectors that have been considered “essential" putting them at a greater risk of getting sick. https://t.co/frDQxTVU8J

Last week the House passed another relief package to provide greater assistance to Americans during the #coronavirus coronavirus crisis. Join @RepPeteAguilar and me tomorrow as we go live on Facebook to discuss the #HeroesAct and answer your questions.  https://t.co/XGfGczEyxx https://t.co/jTXF5UT2uS
Essential workers on the frontlines of the #coronavirus pandemic cannot be an afterthought. We need to include hazard pay in the next relief package. https://t.co/DP8y3dZOkE

UPDATE: The CA Disaster Relief Assistance for Immigrants program will launch this Monday March 18th to provide financial assistance to families impacted by COVID-19. For more information ⬇️ https://t.co/4MCF8r5giO

El Programa de Asistencia para Inmigrantes del estado de California empezara este Lunes 18 de marzo para brindar asistencia financiera a familias afectadas por COVID-19. Para màs información ⬇️ https://t.co/4MCF8r5giO
Pico Rivera is now offering free COVID-19 testing by appointment. They are also looking for volunteers! Volunteers call 562-755-0470 to help. https://t.co/Rcs2yRyrF6

🚨IMPORTANT🚨 If you want to get your Economic Impact Payment by direct deposit you have one day left to update your information with the @IRSnews.  Visit https://t.co/gAd8nZzCy7 to update your info! #COVIDreliefIRS https://t.co/dVA4H3b5sc

Black and brown Americans are not only more likely to get #COVID19 but are also more likely to lose our jobs due to the #coronavirus pandemic. We need to address these racial disparities and put resources into the communities that are most at risk. https://t.co/to6lKo3E2J

I'm pushing for a tax credit to help #COVID19 frontline workers with housing meals child care & more. We ask so much of these heroes and this is one small way to look out for them. https://t.co/1B3kHdYwqb

Thank you to the local labor leaders who joined my first-ever Virtual Labor Advisory meeting. Workers on the frontlines of the #coronavirus emergency deserve PPE & hazard pay. I am committed to giving these workers a voice in the federal government's response to this crisis. https://t.co/GdHobaimEy

If you leave your home to take your dogs on a walk grab food or complete any other essential activity don’t forget to wear a mask. Doing so makes everyone safer as it helps limit the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/tH8UgZVZlg

I’m proud to be a member of @CAPAC and to represent a diverse & vibrant #AAPI community in #CA38. As we work through the #COVID19 pandemic I'm committed to ensuring a full inclusive recovery that sets all Americans on a path to long-term economic security and prosperity.

The #COVID19 pandemic underscores just how deadly #HealthDisparities are for people of color in this country. We need to learn the lessons of this crisis and take a data-driven approach towards #HealthEquity. #HEAA2020

I’m heartbroken to hear this news. Our frontline healthcare workers are facing #COVID19 trauma head on each day. We cannot afford to dismiss their mental health needs and must provide care & support to these workers.  https://t.co/pEKtWTX7Qz

Each spring my office holds an art competition for high school students in #CA38. This year we are holding it virtually due to #COVID19. The deadline for all submissions is 5/13.  Head to my website for more information and rules ⬇️ https://t.co/VgU7A76yqC https://t.co/8JY1WGKIsu

.@RepCardenas & I introduced a bill that would make eligible for testing and treatment all COVID-19 patients regardless of immigration status. Read @Rafael_Bernal_ @thehill piece: https://t.co/RHEgmdNiXL
